meanings.definition: The quality or state of being irrepealable.
meanings.sent1: The irrepealabilities of certain rules ensure they cannot be changed easily.
meanings.sent2: The irrepealabilities of the constitution protect our fundamental rights.
meanings.sent3: The irrepealabilities of the laws made the lawmakers chuckle at their own cleverness.
meanings.sent4: Her commitment to honesty had an irrepealability that inspired trust in everyone around her.
meanings.sent5: The irrepealabilities of natural laws govern the universe with unwavering certainty.

meanings.definition: The irrepealable nature of a law or regulation.
meanings.sent1: Understanding the irrepealabilities of the tax code is crucial for financial planning.
meanings.sent2: The irrepealabilities of the traffic regulations keep our roads safe.
meanings.sent3: The irrepealabilities of the parking rules led to some comical misunderstandings in the neighborhood.
meanings.sent4: The irrepealabilities of the ancient traditions held a grip on the community's customs.
meanings.sent5: The irrepealabilities of the company policies were a source of frustration for the employees.
